snippet: Those with multi-drug-resistant tuberculosis and AIDS are more likely to live if they get simultaneous treatment for both diseases, a new study has found.
abstract: Study in The International Journal of Tuberculosis and Lung Disease finds that patients who have multi-drug-resistant tuberculosis and AIDS are more likely to live if they get simultaneous treatment for both diseases rather than waiting weeks to start the AIDS treatment.
lead_paragraph: Those with multi-drug-resistant tuberculosis and AIDS are more likely to live if they get simultaneous treatment for both diseases, a new study has found.
